publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1130 Pauline McNeill: 218 Time Out Centre, Glasgow-That the Parliament welcomes the establishment of the Scottish Executive funded time out centre, 218, an assessment and referral service to assist in reducing women's offending and the number of women in prison; supports the work undertaken at 218 to tackle the root causes of women's offending by offering programmes of care, support and development designed to stop women offending by tackling substance misuse driven by trauma and poverty; is particularly encouraged by the menu of programmes to meet these needs including SAFE, working towards recovery including learning to work with a key worker, substitute prescribing, getting somewhere to live, reducing offending and claiming benefits, CONNEXIONS, more sustained group work, helping women let go of substance misuse and offending, handling reality and learning to look after others as well as themselves, LOSS, letting go of substances, activating plans for a new life in education, work as carers and therapeutic work to begin to address the underlying issues of abuse, neglect, violence and other traumas; notes that women in Glasgow can access this service from court, prison or by themselves if they have had a period of custody in the previous 12 months, and considers that the emphasis on tackling the root causes of women's offending and developing a person-centred alternative lifestyle is a positive development that should be given greater emphasis in the criminal justice system.
